arm_group.description: Brain Fitness & Brain Training- Posit Science

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to reveal the specific effects of computer-aided cognitive
      training on cerebral reorganization in schizophrenia

detailed_description.textblock:
Impairment in cognitive functions is one of the main symptoms in schizophrenia and is
      currently one of the challenges in the treatment of the disease. In this study we compare
      effects of two computer-aided training programs. One focused on auditory perception and
      processing as a basic ability underlying higher order information processing. The other
      training focus on facial affect discrimination and working memory. Both trainings are
      computer-aided and time-intensive, including up to twenty sessions within four weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of schizophrenia and disorders with psychotic features

          -  Intact auditory perception

          -  Intact visual perception

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Mental retardation

          -  Age over 60

          -  Insufficient German language knowledge

intervention.description: Computer aided cognitive program designed for intensive training of auditory perception, memory and attention
intervention.intervention_name: Brain Fitness & Brain Training- Posit Science

intervention.description: Computer-aided cognitive program designed for intensive training of facial affect discrimination, memory and attention

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline at post-intervention (4-weeks) and 3-months in each to the primary outcome measures: neuropsychological test scores (MCCB), MEG alpha oscillations
